document.masterDocTitle: Lithobius (Monotarsobius) franciscorum sp. nov., a new lithobiid species from the Altai, with a key to the Central Asian species of the subgenus (Chilopoda: Lithobiomorpha)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Lithobius (Monotarsobius) franciscorum sp. nov., a new lithobiid species from the Altai, with a key to the Central Asian species of the subgenus (Chilopoda: Lithobiomorpha)

heading.emphasis:
Key to the Central Asian species of subgenus
Monotarsobius
– males

paragraph.keyLead: 2 Claws of ultimate legs simple, without accessory claw........................................................ 3
3 Ultimate pairs of legs with secondary sexual characters........................................................ 4
- Ultimate pairs of legs without secondary sexual characters.................................................... 15
5 Ocelli in two-four rows on each side of cephalic capsule...................................................... 6

- Four-five ocelli in one row on each side of cephalic capsule....................
Lithobius javanicus (
Zalesskaja, 1978
)

- 15 VaT spine present.......................................................
Lithobius amplinus
Farzalieva, 2006

10 No 15 DaF spines.............................................
Lithobius steppicus (
Farzalieva & Zalesskaja, 2003
)

- 15 DaF spines present.........................................................
Lithobius farzalievae
nom. nov.

12 15 F without dorsodistal projection, 15 F and 15 T with sulci......................
Lithobius vagabundus
Stuxberg, 1876

- 15 F with dorsodistal projection, 15 F and 15 T without sulci.................
Lithobius tuberofemoratus
Farzalieva, 2006
13 No club-like setae on the dorsodistal projection of 15 T..................................................... 14

- Club-like setae on the dorsodistal projection of 15 T present................
Lithobius muminabadicus (
Zalesskaja, 1978
)

14 Dense short setae on the dorsodistal projection of 15 T present.................
Lithobius tarbagataicus
Farzalieva, 2006

- No dense setae on the dorsodistal projection of 15 T..............................
Lithobius curtipes
C.L. Koch, 1847

- 15 DaF and 15 DmF spines present.............................................
Lithobius simplis
Farzalieva, 2006
17 Ultimate pairs of legs with secondary sexual characters....................................................... 18
- Ultimate pairs of legs without secondary sexual characters.................................................... 22

- Wart-like process on 15 T..................................................
Lithobius worogowensis
Eason, 1976

- 14 T with a wart-like process......................................................
Lithobius insolens
nom. nov.

- A dorsodistal group of club-like setae on
15 F.
.....................................
Lithobius franciscorum
sp. nov.

21 15 T with sulci and dorsodistal group of club-like setae...............................
Lithobius alticus (
Loksa, 1965
)

- 15 T without sulci and club-like setae......................................
Lithobius nordenskioldii
Stuxberg, 1876

- Ocelli in two rows on each side of cephalic capsule.................................
Lithobius dobrorukai
nom. nov.

23 17 + 17 antennal articles, no DaC on legs 11–15 .....................................
Lithobius crassus (
Loksa, 1965
)

- 20 + 20 antennal articles, DaC present on legs 11–15 ...........................
Lithobius canaricolor
Farzalieva, 2006
